title: Authors and Citation
text: Rodrigo Zepeda. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zepeda R (2022). ghostpdf: Ghostscript R. R package version 0.0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ghostpdf: Ghostscript in R},   author = {Rodrigo Zepeda},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.1.0}, }

title: Ghostscript in R
text: Ghostpdf wraps around ghostscript provide easy manipulation functions pdf files. Ghostpdf can merge documents, decrypt , encrypt back, transform pdfs images extract pages pdf. Note idea eventually functions applicable PostScript files .

title: Ghostscript in R
text: can install development version ghostpdf GitHub : also need install ghostpdf either page https://www.ghostscript.com/releases/gsdnld.html Unix system package manager : OSX brew install ghostscript Ubuntu/Debian sudo apt-get install ghostscript CentOS/Fedora sudo yum install ghostscript OSX users familiar homebrew open terminal copy: installation completed, reopen terminal write:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("RodrigoZepeda/ghostpdf") /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)" brew install ghostscript

title: Ghostscript in R
code: library(ghostpdf)  #We'll generate some pdf documents for the examples colors <- rainbow(9) for (i in 1:9){   pdf(paste0("Example",i,".pdf"), width = 6, height = 4)   plot(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100), col = colors[i], main = paste0("Page ", i))   dev.off() }

title: Ghostscript in R
text: can merge multiple pdf files single file:
code: #Merge them pdf_merge(output_file = "All_pdfs.pdf") #> NULL  #Or merge some of them: pdf_merge(c("Example1.pdf", "Example6.pdf"), output_file = "Some_pdfs.pdf") #> NULL

title: Ghostscript in R
text: One can extract pages pdf:
code: #Extract from page 2 to 4 pdf_extract("All_pdfs.pdf", first_page = 2, last_page = 4,              output_file = "All_pdfs_subset.pdf")  #Or pages 1, 5 and 8 pdf_extract("All_pdfs.pdf", page_sequence = c(1,5,8),           output_file = "Other_pdfs_subset.pdf")

title: Ghostscript in R
text: can reduce size pdf pdf_shrink enables compression memory-saving tricks:
code: #Check current file size: original_size <- file.info("All_pdfs_subset.pdf")["size"]  #Shrink file pdf_shrink("All_pdfs_subset.pdf") #> NULL  #Check new file size reduced_size <- file.info("All_pdfs_subset.pdf")["size"]  #Verify size is smaller #in this case there isn't much to gain because the pdf was small by itself #in large pdfs this is useful message(paste0("Shrank pdf from ", original_size, " to ", reduced_size)) #> Shrank pdf from 29518 to 27350

title: Ghostscript in R
text: Transform pdf (select) images following formats: png, tiff, jpeg, fax, pcx, bmp, psd:
code: #Transform a pdf into png pdf_to_image("Some_pdfs.pdf", output_file = "cool_plots.png")  #Or sections of another pdf pdf_to_image("All_pdfs.pdf", first_page = 4, last_page = 7, output_file = "cooler_plots.jpg")  #Sections can also be specified with a vector pdf_to_image("All_pdfs.pdf", page_sequence = c(1,5,8,9),               output_file = "cooler_plots.tiff")  #You can also specify the imagedevice for example to grayscale pdf_to_image("All_pdfs.pdf", page_sequence = c(1:4, 7),              image_device = "pnggray",              output_file = "gray_plots.png")  #Additional options can be passed in additional_flags e.g. transparent background pdf_to_image("All_pdfs.pdf", page_sequence = 2,              image_device = "pngalpha",              output_file = "nbg.png",              additional_flags = c("-dBackgroundColor=16#fffff",                                   "-dDownScaleFactor=3"))

title: Ghostscript in R
text: can encrypt pdf file : create decrypted copy:
code: pdf_encrypt("Example1.pdf", password = "mypassword") #> NULL pdf_decrypt("Example1.pdf", password = "mypassword") #> NULL

title: Ghostscript in R
text: like eventually add functionality eps files transform images image pdf.

title: Ghostscript in R
text: recommend executing R administrator. ’s easier (unsafe) way. Open cmd write gswin64c gswin32c. One work. path returned used gs_path functions:
code: pdf_merge(output_file = "All_pdfs.pdf", gs_path = "C:/Program Files/gs/gs9.56.1/bin/gswin64c.exe")

title: Detect ghostscript installation — detect_ghostscript
text: Detect ghostscript installation

title: Detect ghostscript installation — detect_ghostscript
code: detect_ghostscript(quiet = F)

title: Detect ghostscript installation — detect_ghostscript
text: quiet show messages

title: Detect ghostscript installation — detect_ghostscript
text: path ghostscript.

what: ghostpdf: A package for combining multiple pdfs — ghostpdf
title: ghostpdf: A package for combining multiple pdfs — ghostpdf
text: Provides high level interface ghostscript's functions allowing user convert file formats, combine multiple pdfs eps, etc

title: ghostpdf: A package for combining multiple pdfs — ghostpdf
text: pdf_combine

title: PDF Decrypt — pdf_decrypt
text: Decrypts password protected pdf file

title: PDF Decrypt — pdf_decrypt
code: pdf_decrypt(   pdf_file,   password,   output_file = pdf_file,   quiet = T,   gs_path = NULL,   additional_flags = "" )

title: PDF Decrypt — pdf_decrypt
text: pdf_file pdf file count number pages password Defines document encrypted specified owner password. Owner password sets password edit document. output_file output pdf file reduced size quiet output messages gs_path path Ghostscript installation additional_flags Additional string bash flags pass ghostscript

title: PDF Decrypt — pdf_decrypt
text: Needs Ghostscript installation work.

title: PDF Decrypt — pdf_decrypt
code: pdf("Example.pdf", width = 6, height = 4) plot(rnorm(10), rnorm(10), main = "Encrypted example") dev.off() #> agg_png  #>       2   #Shrink file pdf_encrypt("Example.pdf", password = "mypassword", output_file = "pdf_encrypted.pdf") #> NULL pdf_decrypt("Example.pdf", password = "mypassword", output_file = "pdf_decrypted.pdf") #> NULL file.remove(c("Example.pdf","pdf_encrypted.pdf","pdf_decrypted.pdf")) #> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE

title: PDF Encrypt — pdf_encrypt
text: Encrypts pdf file

title: PDF Encrypt — pdf_encrypt
code: pdf_encrypt(   pdf_file,   password,   user_password = password,   output_file = pdf_file,   quiet = T,   gs_path = NULL,   owner_password = password,   permissions = NULL,   encryption_revision = 3,   key_length = 128,   additional_flags = "" )

title: PDF Encrypt — pdf_encrypt
text: pdf_file pdf file count number pages password Set password owner user. Ignored owner_password user_password set. user_password Defines user password opening document edit. output_file output pdf file reduced size quiet output messages gs_path path Ghostscript installation owner_password Defines document encrypted specified owner password. Owner password sets password edit document. permissions Defines PDF permissions flag field. Negative values allowed represent unsigned integers highest bit set. See PDF Reference manual meaning flag bits. encryption_revision Defines encryption method revision number - either 2 3. key_length Defines length (bits) encryption key. Must multiple 8 interval (40, 128). length 40, encryption_revision must 3. additional_flags Additional string bash flags pass ghostscript

title: PDF Encrypt — pdf_encrypt
text: Needs Ghostscript installation work.

title: PDF Encrypt — pdf_encrypt
code: pdf("Example.pdf", width = 6, height = 4) plot(rnorm(10), rnorm(10), main = "Encrypted example") dev.off() #> agg_png  #>       2   #Shrink file pdf_encrypt("Example.pdf", password = "mypassword") #> NULL file.remove("Example.pdf") #> [1] TRUE

title: PDF Extract — pdf_extract
text: Extract pages pdf

title: PDF Extract — pdf_extract
code: pdf_extract(   pdf_file,   first_page = NULL,   last_page = NULL,   page_sequence = NULL,   output_file = "output.pdf",   preserve_annotations = TRUE,   gs_path = NULL,   quiet = T,   auto_rotate_pages,   additional_flags = "" )

title: PDF Extract — pdf_extract
text: pdf_file pdf file extract pages first_page first page extract last_page last page extract page_sequence page numbers extract first_page last_page specified can create page_sequence numbers pdf pages extract output_file name output pdf combines pdfs preserve_annotations boolean flag try preserve annotations pdfs (default TRUE) gs_path path Ghostscript installation quiet output messages auto_rotate_pages automatically rotate pages pasting (default = "None") additional_flags Additional string bash flags pass ghostscript

title: PDF Extract — pdf_extract
text: can either extract continuous sequence pages specifying  first_page last_page discontinuous sequence using page_sequence. Needs Ghostscript installation work.

title: PDF Extract — pdf_extract
code: for (i in 1:9){   pdf(paste0("Example",i,".pdf"), width = 6, height = 4)   plot(rnorm(10), rnorm(10), main = paste("Page",i,".pdf"))   dev.off() }  pdf_merge(list.files(pattern = "\\.pdf"), output_file = "test.pdf", cleanup = TRUE) #> NULL  #Get pages 4 to 7 pdf_extract("test.pdf", 4, 7, output_file = "example_1.pdf") file.remove("example_1.pdf") #> [1] TRUE  #Get pages 1, 5, 7 pdf_extract("test.pdf", page_sequence = c(1,5,7), output_file = "example_2.pdf") file.remove("example_2.pdf") #> [1] TRUE  #Get pages 5 till the end pdf_extract("test.pdf", first_page = 5, output_file = "example_3.pdf") file.remove("example_3.pdf") #> [1] TRUE  file.remove("test.pdf") #> [1] TRUE

title: PDF Combine — pdf_merge
text: Combine multiple pdf's one unique file

title: PDF Combine — pdf_merge
code: pdf_merge(   pdf_files_to_paste = list.files(pattern = "\\.pdf"),   output_file = "output.pdf",   auto_rotate_pages = c("None", "All", "PageByPage"),   pdf_settings = c("default", "ebook", "screen", "printer", "prepress"),   gs_path = NULL,   quiet = TRUE,   cleanup = FALSE,   preserve_annotations = TRUE,   detect_duplicate_images = FALSE,   fast_web_view = FALSE,   max_inline_image_size = NULL,   additional_flags = c("-dAutoFilterColorImages=false", "-dAutoFilterGrayImages=false",     "-dColorImageFilter=/FlateEncode", "-dGrayImageFilter=/FlateEncode",     "-dDownsampleMonoImages=false", "-dDownsampleGrayImages=false") )

title: PDF Combine — pdf_merge
text: pdf_files_to_paste vector pdf files combine one unique pdf character indicating pdf's (*.pdf) output_file name output pdf combines pdfs auto_rotate_pages automatically rotate pages pasting (default = "None") pdf_settings Presets "distiller parameters" one four predefined settings: "eBook" "ebook", "Screen Optimized" "screen", "Print Optimized" "printer", "Prepress Optimized" "prepress" "default" gs_path path Ghostscript installation quiet output messages cleanup Delete files merge? Default F preserve_annotations boolean flag try preserve annotations pdfs (default TRUE) detect_duplicate_images boolean attempts detect image file keep one version image reduce pdf size. fast_web_view boolean reorders output PDF file conform Adobe 'linearised' PDF specification max_inline_image_size Specifies maximum size inline image, bytes. images larger size, pdfwrite create XObject instead embedding image context stream. default value 4000. Note redundant inline images must embedded time occur document, multiple references can made single XObject image. Therefore may advantageous set small zero value source document expected contain multiple identical images, reducing size generated PDF. additional_flags Additional string bash flags pass ghostscript

title: PDF Combine — pdf_merge
text: Needs Ghostscript installation work

title: PDF Combine — pdf_merge
code: for (i in 1:9){   pdf(paste0("Example",i,".pdf"), width = 6, height = 4)   plot(rnorm(10), rnorm(10), main = paste("Example",i,".pdf"))   dev.off() }  #Combine the pdf's pdf_merge(list.files(pattern = "Example.*\\.pdf"), output_file = "merge_1.pdf", cleanup = TRUE) #> NULL file.remove("merge_1.pdf") #> [1] TRUE

title: PDF Number of Pages — pdf_num_pages
text: Get number pages pdf file

title: PDF Number of Pages — pdf_num_pages
code: pdf_num_pages(pdf_file, gs_path = NULL, quiet = T, additional_flags = "")

title: PDF Number of Pages — pdf_num_pages
text: pdf_file pdf file count number pages gs_path path Ghostscript installation quiet output messages additional_flags Additional string bash flags pass ghostscript

title: PDF Number of Pages — pdf_num_pages
text: Needs Ghostscript installation work.

title: PDF Number of Pages — pdf_num_pages
code: for (i in 0:9){   pdf(paste0("Example",i,".pdf"), width = 6, height = 4)   plot(rnorm(10), rnorm(10), main = paste("Example",i,".pdf"))   dev.off() }  pdf_merge(list.files(pattern = "\\.pdf"), output_file = "test.pdf", cleanup = TRUE) #> NULL pdf_num_pages("test.pdf") #> [1] 10 file.remove("test.pdf") #> [1] TRUE

title: PDF Shrink — pdf_shrink
text: Apply functions attempt reduce size pdf

title: PDF Shrink — pdf_shrink
code: pdf_shrink(   pdf_file,   output_file = pdf_file,   gs_path = NULL,   quiet = TRUE,   resolution = 300,   max_inline_image_size = 1000,   pdf_settings = c("screen", "ebook", "default", "printer", "prepress"),   detect_duplicate_images = TRUE,   additional_flags = c("-dCompressFonts=true", "-dCompressStreams=true") )

title: PDF Shrink — pdf_shrink
text: pdf_file pdf file count number pages output_file output pdf file reduced size gs_path path Ghostscript installation quiet output messages resolution Image resolution (dpi) max_inline_image_size Specifies maximum size inline image, bytes. images larger size, pdfwrite create XObject instead embedding image context stream. default value 4000. Note redundant inline images must embedded time occur document, multiple references can made single XObject image. Therefore may advantageous set small zero value source document expected contain multiple identical images, reducing size generated PDF. pdf_settings Presets "distiller parameters" one four predefined settings: "eBook" "ebook", "Screen Optimized" "screen", "Print Optimized" "printer", "Prepress Optimized" "prepress" "default". Lowest "screen". detect_duplicate_images boolean attempts detect image file keep one version image reduce pdf size. additional_flags Additional string bash flags pass ghostscript

title: PDF Shrink — pdf_shrink
text: Needs Ghostscript installation work.

title: PDF Shrink — pdf_shrink
code: for (i in 1:9){   pdf(paste0("Example",i,".pdf"), width = 6, height = 4)   plot(rnorm(10), rnorm(10), main = paste("Example",i,".pdf"))   dev.off() }  pdf_merge(list.files(pattern = "Example.*\\.pdf"), output_file = "test.pdf", cleanup = TRUE) #> NULL #Check current file size: original_size <- file.info("test.pdf")["size"]  #Shrink file pdf_shrink("test.pdf") #> NULL  #Check new file size reduced_size <- file.info("test.pdf")["size"]  #Verify size is smaller original_size > reduced_size #>          size #> test.pdf TRUE  file.remove("test.pdf") #> [1] TRUE

title: PDF to Image — pdf_to_image
text: Convert s pdf png,tiff,jpeg, bmp, fax, pcx psd

title: PDF to Image — pdf_to_image
code: pdf_to_image(   pdf_file,   first_page = 1,   last_page = NULL,   output_file = "output.png",   page_sequence = NULL,   image_device = NULL,   resolution = 750,   preserve_annotations = TRUE,   gs_path = NULL,   quiet = TRUE,   additional_flags = "" )

title: PDF to Image — pdf_to_image
text: pdf_file pdf file extract pages first_page first page extract (default = 1) last_page last page extract (default = number pages pdf) output_file name output image page_sequence page numbers extract first_page last_page specified can create page_sequence numbers pdf pages extract image_device Specify one image devices https://www.ghostscript.com/doc/9.50/Devices.htm#TIFF resolution Image resolution (dpi) preserve_annotations boolean flag try preserve annotations pdfs (default TRUE) gs_path path Ghostscript installation quiet output messages additional_flags Additional string bash flags pass ghostscript

title: PDF to Image — pdf_to_image
text: can either extract continuous sequence pages specifying  first_page last_page discontinuous sequence using page_sequence. Needs Ghostscript installation work.

title: PDF to Image — pdf_to_image
code: if (FALSE) { for (i in 1:20){   pdf(paste0("Example",i,".pdf"), width = 6, height = 4)   plot(rnorm(10), rnorm(10), main = paste("Page",i,".pdf"))   dev.off() }  pdf_merge(list.files(pattern = "Example.*.pdf"), output_file = "test.pdf", cleanup = TRUE)  #Get pages 4 to 18 pdf_to_image("test.pdf", 4, 18) file.remove(list.files(pattern = "output.*.png"))  #Get pages 1, 5, 7 pdf_to_image("test.pdf", page_sequence = c(1,5,7,12), output_file = "example_2.jpg") file.remove(list.files(pattern = "example_2.*.jpg"))  #Get pages 12 till the end pdf_to_image("test.pdf", first_page = 12, output_file = "example_3.tiff", resolution = 100) file.remove(list.files(pattern = "example_3.*.tiff"))  file.remove("test.pdf") }
